summary: The CARES Act lets agencies reimburse contractors for paid leave provided to their employees who can't access work sites during the pandemic (and whose duties cannot be performed remotely). The Departments of Defense, Energy, and Homeland Security, and NASA reported bills totaling $883 million for paid leave costs incurred by contractors. These agencies implemented policies and tracked reimbursements in different ways. We recommended that the...
title: COVID-19 Contracting: Contractor Paid Leave Reimbursements Could Provide Lessons Learned for Future Emergency Responses
